intro: Pentatropis cynanchoides var. senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of this family. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are often pink or red in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in regions with limited rainfall. The plant also serves as a food source for certain insects and is used in traditional medicine in some African countries.
